metadata.name: Pearls #81
metadata.description:
Pearls is a generative minimal artwork made with 100% code in p5js.

This algorithm places perfectly round pearls into multiple stacked grids and connects them in a pleasing way. The small grids lead to interesting emerging patterns. Some see faces and fish, others see ancient hardware and elephants, and some just enjoy the minimal simplicity.

-- controls (in live view)
s: to save the current image
a: to play a small animation

-- some attributes
layout: 2x2 to 34x34
palette: genuary, monochrome red & purple, night
mode: ink, walk
bias: central, north, east, south, west
density: sparse, middle, dense
symmetry: none, vertical, horizontal, point
layer: 2 to 6

metadata.name: Resonance #201
metadata.description:
An exploration of movement, textures, chaos, order, water and fire. Discovering the breaking point in balanced shapes. Is it from nature or out of space? Resonance is a study of previously used techniques combined with Perlin noise

Press s in live mode for a download

Download a higher resolution by adding to the URL:
&density=2 / &density=3 / &density=4

Lammetje December 2022
tags: Abstract Genart Moiré Generativeart p5js Lammetje

metadata.name: Univercell #18
metadata.description:
⚗🦠🌌✨

The center of a digital, quantified space emits 2 560 000 particles through a sequence of expansions, contractions and perturbations. 🌌

Once formed, the evolution of the Univercell can be observed through a series of animations in the manner of a documentary. 🎥

Each Univercell is a unique random and deterministic composition. 🔮

(Click ‘open’ and go fullscreen for best experience !)

🎄🌟🪐🌈☀




-----
* Mint preview *

Minter will get a 1920x1920 PNG bitmap and an infinite animation.

-----
* Technics *

This experience is designed to be executed on a recent GPU (>2016) and displayed on 16/9 screens from FHD to 8K+ (1920x1080 → 7680x4320) at 60FPS for infinite duration.

The physics algorithms take around 20 seconds to generate one Univercell. During generation, a progress indication in percentage is displayed.

- JavaScript / ThreeJS / WebGL
- Unique generative and determinist animation (animation is seeded by the fxhash mint hash)
- Unlimited duration (no loop) / 6 documentary animations
- 20 seconds internal algorithm variations

-----
* Controls *

Keyboard "Space" : take a PNG capture of the current view frame (same ratio as window, max 1920x1080)

⚗ Empiric mode (empiric=on / see URL modifiers below)
Wheel/pinch : zoom in/out to observe the Univercell on different scales
Right click + drag : move the observation area
Keyboard "R" : enable automatic rotation of view

-----
* URL modifiers *

"&empiric=on"
Turn off animations and display a Univercell that can be manually explored.

"&demo=on"
Reduce the cinematics duration to 5 seconds. Allows faster cycling through documentary phases.

"&random=on"
Randomize documentary sequences order.


-----
@HAL09999 – December 21st, 2022

metadata.name: Faux #160
metadata.description:
This project is borne out of my longstanding fascination with brushwork, and the intricate textures that can be created with a brush, some paint and a canvas. Brush strokes are simulated using many overlapping lines and given texture and depth using a custom shader. Another important aspect of this work, is the composite forms that are created by the brush strokes, which are my attempt to emulate the emphatic energy of many abstract painters that have come before me. Color palettes are named after common paint colors, based on the background color used for the palette.

Those who collect during the first tier of the Dutch Auction can claim a signed print. They will be printed on A3 Hahnemuhle Photo Rag, and shipped to the collector free of charge. More details on how to claim a print and specify the necessary shipping information will be provided via the artists twitter (@landlinesart1).

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

metadata.name: MONOLITH #125
metadata.description:
Very limited facts are known about these strange monolithic structures. Black, rectilinear, similar to obsidian stone but made of strange materials. According to legend, an ancient civilization of high intelligence, called the Explorers of Latent Space, distributed hundreds of monoliths throughout time and space in order to study the behavior of species in the infinite Universe.

Some say that it is the divine intelligence of God. Others say that, in spite of their objectual and material condition, the monoliths possess their own consciousness and an intelligence beyond the natural and artificial. Their purpose or objective, to this day, remains a mystery.

_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_

this work is done only with code, using threejs and p5js
it might be a bit slow on low-end devices, be patient

metadata.name: Composizione Semplice #258
metadata.description:
Simple things.
Life is full of them.
Don't let them pass.
Embrace them.
Observe them.
Be present.
Be curious.
Be aware.

Press 's' to save the current view of the artwork.

Emanuele Pasin — 2022
Artwork made with p5js.

metadata.name: NIGHT WORLD #44
metadata.description:
In live mode :
- Hover the mouse to move the light source
- Move the camera with the left mouse button
- Press [p] to export an image to disk (5000x5000)

Add '&animated=false' to the end of the live view URL to not have the animations of the beginning

By Matthieu Segret 2022
NFT License 2.0

Made with Threejs

metadata.name: GRAPHEME #26
metadata.description:
Released on the occasion of the Tribute to Herbert W. Franke. 
www.tribute-hwf.com

“One criterion for art involves the process used by the artist for shaping the work. In the special case of mathematically supported fine art, the artmaking process occurs in a mathematically defined operation that allows the generation and transformation of images, methods used for picture processing.” - Herbert W. Franke

I first came across Franke’s ‘Ornamental Alphabets’ in his book 𝘊𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘶𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘎𝘳𝘢𝘱𝘩𝘪𝘤𝘴 - 𝘊𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘶𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘈𝘳𝘵, and was intrigued with the idea of using a simple letterform to explore different generative image processing techniques. 

I’ve used letters and writing in my work for a long time, both with letterpress printing and in my asemic poetry programs. With asemic writing, I generate unrecognizable letters to reference text, and here I use recognizable letterforms removed from their typical function as language signifiers. 

My goal with this project was to build as much texture and layering as possible by warping and collaging the letters together in various ways. The font I’m using is a design I made years ago to supplement my wood type collection for printing. I really enjoyed being able to bring that part of my past work into my generative art practice. 

Each image is composed of the letters found in the hash for that piece, divided into either vowels or consonants. The program builds on a technique I’ve used before, where I generate an image to an off-screen canvas and then dive through the pixels to pull out the color and form I want to surface in the final image.

25% of the primary sales will be donated on-chain to the Foundation Herbert W. Franke. These funds will be used by ZKM Karlsruhe to digitize Franke’s 1,800 manuscripts and make them publicly available. Any additional funds raised will be donated to the Rütgers Foundation which supports children and young adults in Africa so that they can get access to and work with technology.

- Press “R” to increase the pixel density and reload the image (this can be render intensive and will create a really large file suitable for printing)
- Press “S” to save a copy

Made with p5js
Artist: Sarah Ridgley
October, 2022

metadata.name: d/e/m/boss TWO #202
metadata.description:
TWO combines a couple of distribution algorithms, one that creates a mesh with different variations and the other that plays with packing probabilities.

Please be patient, it takes a while to render (30-60 secs) and draws around 6M circles during 4 steps.

Responsive, zoom out browser window and refresh to get a larger output.
's' save the current canvas

TWO is part of a series playing with textures creating emboss/deboss effect.

de/
/boss
em/

100% code, made with p5js
See License.md

metadata.name: Florescence #336
metadata.description:
Digitally crafted flowers in pots for virtual window sills.

In the spirit of the piranha plant from the Mario Bros videogame. We wanted to create a project that acknowledges the playful depiction of nature in early videogames by creating a retro futuristic collectible that explores aesthetics over gameplay, whilst preserving the playful energy of these early digital worlds. There are many game elements that have emerged over the years that have become iconic in their own right. Their memorable designs have come to represent the exciting feeling of when we first discovered these worlds, but over time an appreciation for their simple design execution, harmony and balance has emerged. Art can exist in many forms and places including a digital pot plant.

Rarity:

There are a total of 23 hand-drawn and animated sprites divided into 4 groups Firelillies, Flytraps, Quasars and Stargazers and there are 15 possible combinations made from these 4 groups. 18% of the collection is a combination of these 4 groups which we can call random and the remaining 72% is divided between the remaining 14 combinations.


There are 3 possible grid systems 1x1, 3x3 and 4x4 

3% 1x1

40% 3x3

57% 4x4



There are 14 possible placement points for all grids and 76 stem/sprite arragement in total



For the pots and stems there are 11 colors to choose and  no rarities for color combinations.



The flower distribution can be either symmetric or random. 35% symmetric and 65% random



Export options:

Pressing 's' on desktop or holding for 2 seconds will download gif to whatever the current device resolution is. To export at a different resolution open the token in new window by clicking 'open' link under the token image and add "&exportsize=1080" or "&exportsize=2160" to end of the url and hit enter then either hold for 2 seconds or press 's' to create gif and download.

metadata.name: Bankoo #9
metadata.description:
The word affects and reshapes land in an eternal cycle.

The development of this series invited me to cross the land through songs and glyphs and to discover the Manding languages script: N'Ko. It is a cables.gl patch that blends procedural terrains and text strings made from 8 letters whose order is continuously randomized (it takes some time, be patient).

The piece has some controls:
- Use 1, 2, 3 and 4 to change the view.
- Use P to open the performance panel.
- Use S to download a black and white image of the terrain to use as height map or to hear it using PIXELSYNTH (https://ojack.xyz/PIXELSYNTH/)

A more detailed article about this artwork can be found here: https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/bankoo-or-nko-or-u%2B07c0-u%2B07ff ⛰️

objkt.name: View From Our Window Depicted In Rhombuses #30

metadata.name: View From Our Window Depicted In Rhombuses #30
metadata.description:
We began this composition by creating coloured pencil strokes. We then made rhombuses and arranged them in different ways. It wasn't until the work was nearly complete that we realised we were creating the view from our desk, looking out through the window into the garden. Sky, clouds, leaves, fence posts, reflections on the glass and a large ceramic star hanging.

There are 4 layers which may or may not be visible as default but which can be toggled with the keyboard:
b - set a dark background to the whole piece
w - weather - each piece has the potential for either rain, snow or wind
c - cloud or sunburst
s - star
Number keys render the image at increasing resolutions up to 7

issuer.name: View From Our Window Depicted In Rhombuses

metadata.name: Substitute #27
metadata.description:
Substitite is far away from anything made by "Zagreb school of animated films" but it is inspired with Oscar winning cartoon “Surogat” and homage to Dusan Vukotic.

Thanks

press “l” to restart animation 
Press “s” to save screen 

Substitute was created using p5js.
@Qotonana
June, 2022.
